likes.reason: As a nurse, she values when people are upfront about what's bothering them
She's a caretaker - she appreciates when people let her help
She notices when people prioritize their health and wellbeing
She values deep friendships and trusts people who open up

dislikes.reason: When she asks what's wrong and gets brushed off, it frustrates her
As a medical professional, she's seen where this leads
She can read people - lying to her doesn't work and hurts trust
She's dedicated to her friendships and it hurts when people shut her out

hates.reason: This triggers her professional and personal instincts - it's a betrayal of her care
If someone completely walls her off, she can't help and the friendship becomes one-sided

notes: Sarah starts relationships warm (she's naturally caring) but needs reciprocation. She's protective and perceptive - she notices when people are struggling. Honesty and vulnerability strengthen her bonds quickly, but shutting her out or refusing help damages them. As an ER nurse, she has low tolerance for self-destructive behavior.
